banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How an entrepreneurial potter helped restore beauty to a city
videoData.socialTitle: How an entrepreneurial potter helped restore beauty to a city

nodes.whoTheyAre: Emma Bridgewater has become a household name known for her sprightly, family-inspired pottery. Bridgewater studied English at London University, establishing the company in London and Stoke-on-Trent with no formal business training. With a passionate refusal to outsource manufacturing abroad, she has become a champion of British manufacturing, spearheading the revival in traditional craft in Stoke-on-Trent, the historical home of British pottery.

videoData.description: At 23-years-old, Emma Bridgewater boldly launched her new ceramic company in Stoke-on-Trent, a city with rich ceramic traditions but a present that resembled Detroit. She tapped into the dwindling yet still vibrant reservoir of skills and traditions still residing in the city and is now at the center of an economic and cultural renaissance. Emma shares her tumultuous journey to entrepreneurship in an interview with TED speaker and serial-entrepreneur Margaret Heffernan.
videoData.socialDescription: At 23-years-old, Emma Bridgewater boldly launched her new ceramic company in Stoke-on-Trent, a city with rich ceramic traditions but a present that resembled Detroit.
